questions.question_text: Identity and access management (IAM) is a security discipline that ensures which of the following?
questions.answer_description: Options A and C are also correct, but included in B, making B the best choice. D is incorrect, because we don't want unauthorized users gaining access.

choices.C: That all users are properly authenticated
choices.B: That the right individual gets access to the right resources at the right time for the right reasons.
choices.A: That all users are properly authorized
choices.D: That unauthorized users will get access to the right resources at the right time for the right reasons

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
B. That the right individual gets access to the right resources at the right time for the right reasons.

questions.question_text: Maintenance mode requires all of these actions except:

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
The action not required during maintenance mode is removing all active production instances, as maintenance aims to keep the system running even if it's with limited capabilities. Therefore, the correct answer is option A. Remove all active production instances.

During maintenance mode, one of the goals is to minimize disruption to the system while necessary updates, patches, or repairs are carried out. The actions listed in the question are typical steps for maintaining system integrity and limiting use during this time. However, the action that is not required as part of entering maintenance mode is to remove all active production instances. This is not typically done because it would mean taking the entire system offline, which is contrary to the intent of keeping the system operational albeit with limited functionality during maintenance. Instead, active production instances usually continue to run, possibly with limited capacity or functionality.

Selected Answer: A
When a system enters maintenance mode, the goal is to ensure that security and monitoring remain active while preventing normal operations. Production instances do not need to be removedâ€”they can remain, but may be paused, restricted, or placed in read-only mode.

Key Maintenance Mode Actions:
B. Ensure Logging Continues â†’ Critical for tracking changes and detecting unauthorized access.
C. Initiate Enhanced Security Controls â†’ Ensures restricted access and prevents vulnerabilities during maintenance.
D. Prevent New Logins â†’ Avoids unauthorized changes while maintenance is in progress.
ðŸ”¹ Why Not "Remove All Active Production Instances"?

Removing instances is not required; instead, they are restricted, paused, or set to maintenance mode.
Deleting production instances could lead to data loss or service disruptions, which is not the purpose of maintenance mode.
It should be A. We can disable necessary apps and/or reboot required servers, but not remove.

Selected Answer: C
C. Initiate enhanced security controls

questions.answer_description: While the other answers are all steps in moving from normal operations to maintenance mode, we do not necessarily initiate any enhanced security controls.

questions.question_text: What is one of the reasons a baseline might be changed?
questions.answer_description: If the CMB is receiving numerous change requests to the point where the amount of requests would drop by modifying the baseline, then that is a good reason to change the baseline. None of the other reasons should involve the baseline at all.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
A. Numerous change requests

questions.answer_description: In a trusted third-party model of federation, each member organization outsources the review and approval task to a third party they all trust. This makes the third party the identifier (it issues and manages identities for all users in all organizations in the federation), and the various member organizations are the relying parties (the resource providers that share resources based on approval from the third party).

choices.D: A contracted third party/the various member organizations of the federation
choices.A: The users of the various organizations within the federations within the federation/a CASB
choices.B: Each member organization/a trusted third party

discussion.content: D; In a federation as a service setup like Okta. Okta is the trusted thoird party that facilitates/provides identity services with member organizations (office 365, adobe, other )

Selected Answer: D
D. A contracted third party/the various member organizations of the federation

questions.answer_description: We don't use DAM in place of encryption or masking; DAM augments these options without replacing them. We don't usually think of the database interaction as client-server, so A is the best answer.

choices.C: Used in the place of encryption
choices.D: Used in place of data masking

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
Database Activity Monitoring (DAM) is a security technology used to track and analyze database access and activities to detect unauthorized or anomalous behavior. DAM can be implemented as:
Host-based DAM â†’ Monitors database activity directly on the server using agents.
Network-based DAM â†’ Monitors database traffic at the network level using network sniffing techniques.
Why Not the Others?
B. Server-based or client-based â†’ DAM focuses on database monitoring, not distinguishing between server-side vs. client-side security.
C. Used in the place of encryption â†’ Encryption protects data confidentiality, whereas DAM monitors database activityâ€”they serve different purposes.
D. Used in place of data masking â†’ Data masking hides sensitive data, while DAM detects and logs database interactionsâ€”they complement each other but are not interchangeable.

Selected Answer: A
A: Host-based or network-based
